meanings.sent1: She misestimated the distance to the park and ended up walking much farther than she thought.
meanings.sent2: He misestimated the cost of the project, leading to budget issues later on.
meanings.sent3: The magician misestimated the number of rabbits in his hat and they kept multiplying!
meanings.sent4: Her intuition misestimated the danger lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The explorer misestimated the depth of the cave, plunging into darkness unexpectedly.

meanings.definition: To make an incorrect estimate of (something).
meanings.sent1: They misestimated the time it would take to finish the puzzle, thinking it would be quick.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast misestimated the amount of rain, causing surprise showers.
meanings.sent3: The chef misestimated the amount of salt in the soup, making it too salty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The detective misestimated the suspect's alibi, leading to a breakthrough in the case.
meanings.sent5: The teacher misestimated the difficulty of the test, surprising the students with its complexity.
